newsitem.title: USA: Tandem, CA to invest $20 million.
newsitem.headline: Tandem, CA to invest $20 million.

text.p: Tandem Computers Inc and Computer Associates International said they will be investing more than $20 million in technology to develop fault-tolerant computing and clustering capabilities at reduced prices.

Tandem president and chief executive Roel Pieper and Computer Associates chairman and chief executive Charles Wang said under a joint development and cross-licensing pact they will integrate products for multi-platform computing.
"As Charles already said, the two companies expect to spend more than $20 million bringing these technologies to market," Pieper said in a news conference monitored by telephone.
